bootstrap.description: Use Bootstrap classes in your HTML code to unify and customize the visual rendering of your items. The documentation contains many examples for each desired rendering.

icons.description: Use Font Awesome or Bootstrap icons to display items. The documentation contains many examples for each desired rendering.

datatable.description: DataTables allows you to easily add search, sorting, export, and pagination to your HTML tables. To use the Bootstrap theme, add the 'table' class. Refer to the documentation for examples and more information.

mermaid.description: Mermaid allows you to create diagrams. Must be contained in a 'pre' tag with the class 'mermaid'. Refer to the documentation for more information.

nunjucks.description: Nunjucks allows you to define templates. Use the data from your sources to build your structure on these data (loops, conditions, ...). Refer to the documentation for more information.

date.description: Allows to manipulate the format of dates.

find.description: Allows to search for a value in an array of objects and return the first object that matches.

fromjson.description: Allows to convert a JSON string to an object.

setattribute.description: Allows to modify an attribute of an object.

javascript.description: The JavaScript code is executed after the HTML code and can use Nunjucks. It is important to note that each datalchemist object can contain its own associated JavaScript code, so it is recommended to avoid potential conflicts with other objects by using unique variable or function names and minimizing the impact on the global environment.
